website_summaries.verdict: These budget-friendly liners afford users a choice of two material types and have generous dimensions that can be cut in half for small diapers.
pros: Bamboo derived viscose construction is soft and breathable
Removing solid waste is relatively painless, thanks to the extra size
Flushable, if your plumbing can handle it
Tears off the roll without ripping
cons: Can leave lint stuck to the skin with heavy wetting

customer_reviews.title: These have been amazing for our cloth diapering of a toddler
customer_reviews.text: These have been amazing for our cloth diapering of a toddler. The idea of using a sprayer always turned me away from cloth diapers, but these have made the sprayer almost completely useless. It catches most of the poo and I can just toss it in the toilet or garbage and toss the diaper in my wet bin. Every once in a while the liner shifts and I have to spray off the diapers, but not often and normally only when my daughter has a major blowout. I will continue to buy these for her and for our next children.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea B.

customer_reviews.title: Soft but absorbs too much liquid
customer_reviews.text: Extremely soft but the liner absorbs a lot of liquid and stays wet against the skin. My daughter ended up with a mild diaper rash after we started using these liners. We had to stop using them and switched back to Osocozy brand which stays dry and just catch solids.
customer_reviews.author: Tootsie

customer_reviews.title: beware: description of the product has changed
customer_reviews.text: this review is for the cloth diaper LINERS (yellow package): these liners are nothing compared to the previous version (green package), this don’t stretch, very uncomfortable for the baby bottom, they slide and don’t stay in place, with the older version baby never had a rash but when I try to buy they say unavailable, please come back with the green package liners, thanks.
customer_reviews.author: valdostamom

customer_reviews.title: Softest, best functioning diaper liner
customer_reviews.text: I have tried two other brands of cloth diaper liners, and these are by far the best! They actually absorb instead of flushing liquid out of the diaper, are super soft on baby's skin which means they also stay in place better. Very eco-friendly, too! Definitely will purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Krista W.

customer_reviews.title: Great price on diaper liners
customer_reviews.text: Great price on diaper liners. I wanted some that were available for subscribe and save, so I gave these a try. They are a little heavier (less flimsy) than some I've tried, tear evenly and cleanly from the roll (some brands don't tear as well), and that they are biodegradable and flushable is awesome. I haven't (never do) flushed any, but it gives me peace of mind that they will break down in the landfill versus sit there for eternity. I will definitely continue to use these. I have tried most of the brands out there (that I can find on amazon) and these are easily in my top 3 choices.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks

customer_reviews.title: You want me to put that where?
customer_reviews.text: I think if you dry cleaned, ironed, and starched a cheap dryer sheet, this is might be what you'd get. I can't imagine using these on any sensitive parts. This company makes bamboo liners (green label) that are quite nice tho. I'd order those instead if I were you. I ordered these by mistake and haven't made that mistake again. Sticking to the green label from now on.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Easy, durable, and affordable
customer_reviews.text: These work great. They don't irritate my baby's skin, hold all the solid waste, and fit the diapers perfectly. I recommend these to anyone cloth diapering, def don't use cloth without liners...lol they make clean up super easy and I actually use the clean parts of the soiled liner as a base wipe, meaning I get the solids off my little one with this First and follow with a warm cloth wipe. My baby is super happy and extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Charyn Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Great liner and value
customer_reviews.text: These cover a wider area than the liners I was previously using, which means there was less poo in the creases on the side of the diaper. I also like them because you can wash them once and reuse, (if there is only pee on them). Which means even more environmentally friendly points. :) (After a second wash, it starts to degrade very quickly.)
customer_reviews.author: K. Nicastri

customer_reviews.title: Too Coarse And Hard To Use
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have usually used the bamboo liners from Dandelion Diapers, but decided to try these to save a little money. They've turned out to be less than great. They're not even a little bit soft and are too inflexible to make it easy to fold the sides under so that they don't stick out the edge of the diaper, making diaper changes much more complicated. They also seem to contribute to diaper rash; my son is ten months old and never had any diaper rash at all until a couple of weeks after we started using these. I'd recommend spending the few dollars extra for the bamboo liners.
customer_reviews.author: Jaymes

customer_reviews.title: Superior to Bumkin's!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using bumkin's for 5 years and I thought those were the best, but these are my new favorite!! They are the right size for full coverage, they keep the solids off the diaper, no rashes or issues and you truly don't have to spray the diaper!! Bumkin's tended to bunch up, but these are thicker and don't bunch at all!! We found our new brand!!
customer_reviews.author: Lepsalm139

customer_reviews.title: Not a very big fan if the texture
customer_reviews.text: For my purposes, these work. I use them inside cloth diapers for easy poop removal. That being said, The texture is not very soft, almost papery. I wouldn't be comfortable with that on my butt... I've used several different brands of the bamboo liners, and they are much softer.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Leece

customer_reviews.title: Made a bigger mess.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice idea, but in practice it made a bigger mess. It got all bunched up in the diaper and then separating it from the diaper was messy, and I usually use a corner of the diaper to wipe, but it didn't work with this thing in there. Plus, you've got an extra step when putting the diaper on. Easier to just hose off a poopy cloth.
customer_reviews.author: nutsaboutbooks

customer_reviews.title: Soft but not extremely durable.
customer_reviews.text: Tried these instead of my usual grovia liners. It is very soft but thats what makes the durability suck. It sticks to my kids bottom when its wet and doesnt stay in place. Sometimes it leaves lint on her bottom. These are a good product for the price but they arent my favorite. Giving 3 stars because it does get the job done for the most part.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Windon

customer_reviews.title: Great liners!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these liners. Switched from another brand that was causing chafing Timmy son while he played. These are super soft and are a great barrier. Couldn't give them 5 stars due to an issue I have with their packaging. They stick the paper/label to the liners inside the plastic wrap with ruins the first two liners making them unusable for each roll.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly K.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the environment and baby, too!
customer_reviews.text: These flushable diaper liners make cloth diapers so easy to clean! Just flush away the solid waste in the toilet, and wash the diaper in the laundry. I give these as baby shower gifts to all new mothers, along with some all-in-one cloth diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Marian Clifton

customer_reviews.title: Texture is hard
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item based on other reviews but after using this as a diaper liner in my cloth diapers for 2 months now I am not pleased with this product. The texture of this is quite hard and thus I do not think it is quite comfortable for my baby. This also affects how it folds in the diapers to ensure there is sufficient coverage. Overall I will prefer another liner- I have used bumpkins previously and that worked well but was more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Rory

customer_reviews.title: Soft and works great
customer_reviews.text: The bamboo liners are soft and work great. We prefer them to the GroVia Ingeo fiber ones -- which are stiffer. We use them in combination with Thirsties natural all-in-ones and wrap the sides around the stitched in inserts -- which keeps them in place nicely. When baby does a poo, we take the liner and put it into a biodegradable dog poop bag and then toss the diaper in the diaper pail. The whole process is pretty easy and we've been very happy with our cloth diaper decision,
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: very soft
customer_reviews.text: they do the job. My husband is old, but not ready for security underwear. So, these keep his outter wear from being soiled. I tape them in with either double sided tape or removable poster tape. It removes from his regular underwear along with the liner before laundry.
customer_reviews.author: Friend

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but DON'T FLUSH THEM!
customer_reviews.text: These work great in all of the brands of cloth diapers that we have. However, as with most things that say they are flushable, I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND FLUSHING THESE. We made the mistake of doing that and clogged up our sump-pump. $200 later . . . So don't flush them. They are large enough that there is always a corner untouched by poo--pick it up by that corner and toss in the trash. You'll be much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Not a big fan
customer_reviews.text: Not a big fan of these liners because urine does not pass through vey well. They hold the urine against my daughter's skin causing irritation esp. if she has a rash. With other brands I've been able to simply change out the diaper insert for a few urine changes because the liner and diaper wick dry, but with these it's not the case -I have to toss with every change. Maybe for an infant with very liquidy poop these will be beneficial so I'm saving them for my little one due in Sept but depending on how they affect his/ her skin will determine if I use them up or not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Catches the mess well!
customer_reviews.text: So far these have been able to handle some of the biggest loads in my little girls cloth diapers. There has been a few sneaky blow outs that escaped, but that is expected in those situations. Very soft. Does not irritate bums.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Biodegradable and Flushable Natural Diaper Liners
customer_reviews.text: These are not absorbent. But they do tell you that they are only to collect solid baby diaper waste. I love that the cloth diaper only gets the wet and these liners collect and don't trespass the solids. It very well contains them. They are soft and works for my baby!!
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: I decided to try this brand for my cloth diaper ...
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try this brand for my cloth diaper inserts after loving the BioLiners. These seemed softer but held far more moisture against my baby's skin. I still used these up and they did the job but I prefer the material of the Bioliners.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Star

customer_reviews.title: Very comparable to GroVia
customer_reviews.text: I bought these when the price of the GroVia diaper liners increased. I had been using the GroVia liners for over two years between two different children and was very unsure about changing products. I see now that there was no need to be uneasy about the change. They are very comparable. I'm not sure that I would choose one above the other, except by price. These diapers are a tad bit smaller than the GroVia, but I actually think they fit the BumGenius diapers that we use better than the GroVia ones. If they stay the same price, I will definitely be buying these again!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: A friend recommended Grovia liners
customer_reviews.text: Cloth diapered my son from birth. Gave up when we started him on solids because my husband and I were fighting over who had to spray out the poop. He started developing nasty, raw, and bloody rashes. We needed to go back. A friend recommended Grovia liners, and after using a roll of those I started my search for something softer (grovia are kind of rough) and cheaper. LOVE THESE. So soft they're perfect for going in the diaper region.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Osborne

customer_reviews.title: So far all the poop just sticks so badly to ...
customer_reviews.text: So far all the poop just sticks so badly to baby that it makes a mess trying to get off - we rarely use right now. It goes off the sides and ends up getting on diaper. Yes much less so but it just doesn't seem necessary - my baby is breastfed so we don't usually need to use this type of liner as we aren't even needing to soak our diapers. Two rinses and a proper wash routine is all we do.
customer_reviews.author: David Baffoni

customer_reviews.title: These liners are awesome! Our little one has VERY sensitive skin and ...
customer_reviews.text: These liners are awesome! Our little one has VERY sensitive skin and all of the conventional wipes really irritated his tender skin. We ended up moistening these liners and using them as flushable wipes. His little bottom recovered and they are very durable and soft. We just bought another roll to use as wipes. Also great to add into the diaper for an added layer of absorbency.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Storey

customer_reviews.title: Saved our cloth diapering experience
customer_reviews.text: I've only tried one other type of disposable liner, and they were not flushable. These are life-changing! They're soft, natural material, and we have found the length to be sufficient. I'm so glad we found these! I was about to give up on cloth diapering. Scraping poop off into a toilet just really wasn't my favorite thing.
customer_reviews.author: zipslc

customer_reviews.title: ... brand of liners I've tried and by far my favorite. They are softer than any of the others ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the fifth brand of liners I've tried and by far my favorite. They are softer than any of the others but the best part is their size. I think the others are too large and a hassle to fold inside the diaper. These are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Dailey

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: We are a returning customer to this brand because the liners are soft, big enough, they stay in place, and they keep the cloth diaper free of poop. We compost them as well, added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Makes my day easier
customer_reviews.text: I use these being every diaper I put on my daughter. You have to fold them a bit to fit properly but I love them. Easy to tear, doesn’t irritate my daughters skin, I peel it right into the toilet and that’s it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Eleanore

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: These liners are stiff and thin. They shift. I ended up having to use them with a viva paper towel because soft poo leaks right through. There's always poo on the diaper gussets.
customer_reviews.author: A. Aguirre

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite cloth diaper liners!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried 4 or 5 different brand of liners and these are our favorite. We were disappointed when they became unavailable for several months but rejoiced (seriously so glad!) when they became available again!
customer_reviews.author: SalmonFace

customer_reviews.title: Soft,durable yet leaks thru.
customer_reviews.text: I used a few brands of liners and I have to say , while these are soft yet sturdy , they leak thru a LOT . The cloth diaper gets stained almost as much as if there were no protection , it’s really sad .
customer_reviews.author: Rhiannon

customer_reviews.title: Not functional
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan. I was used to using grovia liners and ordered this one because it was organic and cheaper. While the liners are softer and I imagine they feel better on baby’s bum, they tear easily and disenigrate inside the diaper while he wears them. I will not be purchasing these again.
customer_reviews.author: nicolastobler

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I really like the ingo ones. They let pee pass and stay dry so honestly I reuse them if they aren’t poopy. Just throw away the poppy ones. They catch the poop really well and I think they fit in the diapers just great. I pull some out of the diaper to ensure it catches all the poo. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as thick as other brands
customer_reviews.text: We have used other liners before that were thicker than this brand, and we preferred the others. This particular brand is thin, and when our child has a BM, it leaks through onto the pad/diaper. Other brands, we didn't find this to be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes cloth easier
customer_reviews.text: Makes cloth diapers easier. I absolutely do NOT flush them down the toilet (that’s terribly for septic or sewage. Just dump in toilet and pitch the cloth in a bag and throw away.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Christensen

customer_reviews.title: I WOULD NEVER USE CLOTH WITHOUT THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: I would NOT use cloth diapers without this product. I cut the entire roll in half bit wish I had left the second half whole. This baby grew so fast that a half sheet wouldn't do it, I haven't flushed them so I don't know if they're truly flushable, but once I have to start flushing them I will update review. It keeps his bottom and the diaper clean from any solids and at the same time doesn't make him break out in any rashes from being against the skin. Will be keeping this in the house for daily use until he's potty trained.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: I hated these! They did not hold up well at all. They made a bigger mess than the actual poop or pee. They crumbled like paper & I literally had to peal them off my baby’s bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Cabe

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but won't buy again.
customer_reviews.text: We usually buy bumpkin flushable liners but decided to give these a try. They're ok, my biggest complaint is they don't stretch, which is what we typically do to make sure they cover all of the diaper area, which has caused a lot of messy clean-ups for her solids. We probably won't purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: KimCorv

customer_reviews.title: The perfect disposable liner for cloth diapers!
customer_reviews.text: We don't have a lot of experience with flushable liners so we have nothing to compare these to; however; there will be no need to compare them! They are so soft and wonderful and work perfectly on our cloth diapers! We have no need to try any other brand because these are absolutely perfect! The individual liners tear off so easily and stay put on the diaper with no bunching or shifting at all. They are an absolute lifesaver when changing dirty diapers! We will definitely be ordering these disposable liners again!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Robertson

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL LINERS!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Lifesavers for me since spraying or swishing poo is not high on my "to-do" list. As a busy working Mom who has her child with family and friends these are easy to remove and don't gross me out so badly! I have not tried to flush them, as I do not believe our toilets to be reliable, but they are thin and would probably flush just fine.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great at wicking away moisture/keeping diaper cream away from inserts. Planning on washing non-soiled liners to reuse. I don't flush them, I just toss them in the trash with the wipes.
customer_reviews.author: AmberTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: awesome liners for cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: Got these to test them out versus a boxed version and I really like these ones as well. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Like Grovia more
customer_reviews.text: I like the Grovia liners more - but these will work for the price. They hold up pretty well and transfer to the pail well. The Grovia ones are slightly thicker and feel more durable. But for a better price, I will make these work.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Will be buying these again. Soft, easy to tear off, easy to use. Makes poop diapers easy to clean! I got grovia liners to try as well and these are MUCH better.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle R LeFebvre

customer_reviews.title: Not happy about the scent.
customer_reviews.text: I did not like the scented smell that was on the liners when I opened the package. The product is supposed to be unscented yet it had a strong smell of some sort. I would not buy these liners again becasue of that smell. Other than that works great, just as comparable to the Grovia liners.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Soft as a baby's rear
customer_reviews.text: These are so soft. My wife and I were using the other liner from the same company (yellow packaging), and they were rougher. However, these retain more moisture than their counterpart.
customer_reviews.author: va2dc

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic for their intended use but I was very frustrated to discover that the paper is glued/taped/stuck to one of the actual liners. Any attempt to remove it ruins the liner. So really you get 99.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin O.

customer_reviews.title: okay
customer_reviews.text: These are a bit wider than another brand we tried....the quality is good, they are soft to touch. I'm not a fan of how they unroll - it's like a paper towel, you rip it off...another brand we tried pulled from the middle of the roll and it kept it nice and easier to remove.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised to find these were not only softer but had better perforations. Will make the switch
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because my regular brand - Grovia - was out of stock. Pleasantly surprised to find these were not only softer but had better perforations. Will make the switch!
customer_reviews.author: C. Self

customer_reviews.title: Bamboo cloth liners
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for more value over Heartfelt and so happy! We only use bamboo for his delicate area and couldn't be happier. Please get them back in stock soon!
customer_reviews.author: Ericka alonzo

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Theyre nice, my only complaint is they stick the label on the roll instead of loose or on the plastic, so when you remove the label, it rips a sheet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dislike
customer_reviews.text: I did not like these. They were very rough to the touch. I have bought the Bamboo liners from Dandelion and LOVED them. These not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Bre A.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well even for EBF baby
customer_reviews.text: This is the first brand I tried with my cloth diapers, as a first time mom. But I had heard that all off these kind of liners didn't really work that well with exclusively breastfed babies-- that the poop was too runny. I found that these actually caught a lot of it though, I was really impressed! My baby is still little and hasn't started solids yet, so that will be a bigger test to see how much these liners can catch then. But so far these have worked really well.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah E

customer_reviews.title: Not washable & too small
customer_reviews.text: NOT FLUSHABLE. I wash the pee ones in the washing machine and reuse them (and throw the poop ones in the trash.) And they are not long enough, poop goes either to the front or back, not enough coverage in the diaper. But they work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They shift and feel very damp
customer_reviews.text: These liners shift a ton and poop always ends up on the diaper anyways, making it useless. They also feel very damp when wet and now my baby is developing a rash since I’ve switched to these from the Grovia ones, only switched because I wanted to try other kinds, big mistake. I will definitely be switching back to Grovia liners because they work so much better!
customer_reviews.author: M H

customer_reviews.title: Not as soft as other brands. I usually cut ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as soft as other brands. I usually cut the other ones in half and stretch them. These don't have any stretch. They do the job but since they aren't as soft they tend to slide around and sometimes end up bunched up. I saved $0.01. Next time I will be buying the other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Fabry

customer_reviews.title: these are great BUT they are not really flushable - my toilet ...
customer_reviews.text: these are great BUT they are not really flushable - my toilet wasn't draining right and when I got a plumber out, he found tons of these in the drain. So I still use them but just put them in the trash instead of flush.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: The best in Amazon. I have tried all brands and this is the best 1. Softest 2. Long enough 3. Durable 4. Doesn’t hurt my baby’s skin
customer_reviews.author: Mei

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but won't buy again
customer_reviews.text: These serve their purpose, but they stick to my little guy's bum and sometimes irritate his skin. He does not have sensitive skin and using these is one of the only times he's had any irritation on his bottom. I'll go back to a different liner when I'm through these.
customer_reviews.author: SWT

customer_reviews.title: This product is saving me from a lot of gross ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is saving me from a lot of gross moments spraying down my diapers. Only on occasion do I need to spray the corners or edges of my cloth diapers, usually after a big BM. I double up on the inserts and still have enough to last me through the month.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Smiley

customer_reviews.title: They are a good size to fit in the diaper
customer_reviews.text: These liners are soft and fairly thick. They are a good size to fit in the diaper. We have tried other brands, but prefer this liner!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: My favorite
customer_reviews.text: I've tried three different kinds. This is my favorite. Big, soft, good price. Only negative is they leave fuzzies sometimes down there. Eek trying to pull off!
customer_reviews.author: Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Save time and stink NO spraying diapers needed!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this product. I hardly ever write reviews but... THIS product saves so much time and money. I didn't have this 8 yrs ago when I cloth diapered my first baby and I spent time spraying diapers making a mess. This liner makes the poop flushable without a mess. I have been able to reuse the same diaper if he hasn't wet it but just pooped. I just take the liner out and put the clean diaper back on!!!! TOTALLY RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: Allison G.

customer_reviews.title: These saved cloth diapering!
customer_reviews.text: Cloth diapers a breastfed baby is simple--Just throw the dirty diapers in the wash because the poop is water soluble. But once our son started eating solid food, things got complicated and aggravating. But these block all the solids! They're soft and simple and stay in place, and cloth diapering is once again a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Garner

customer_reviews.title: super soft and perfect size
customer_reviews.text: great quality and size they are super soft and great for eliminating a lot of the mess in cloth diapers
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Go ahead and buy these. Buy a lot of these.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, most definitely. Soft, but I think I will upgrade to the bamboo, mostly out of curiosity. I had almost given up on cloth diapering once my daughter started solids but tried these. It's as easy as ever now.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: ... bought these when they were on sale I'm so sad that they are more expensive now
customer_reviews.text: I must've bought these when they were on sale I'm so sad that they are more expensive now. They work great for my boy's sensitive bum and keep clean up rather easy with my cloth diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Hilliard

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Slightly more expensive than the brand I usually buy. Huge thumbs up for how silky it feels! It feels a little lighter than my usual brand. It also hasn't faced a FULL load so I don't know how durable this is
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: These are my new favorite liner!
customer_reviews.text: I had only tried two brands before this one: one was nice and big, but seemed scratchy; the other was kind of small, but nice and soft. This one is the perfect goldilocks liner - big enough to cover the whole diaper, and soft enough for my little one's tush. Plus, it's cheaper per liner than most others.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Too sticky on baby’s bottom
customer_reviews.text: They stick to my baby’s bottom even when she’s barely wet and it’s a task trying to get it off.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great service sadly product didn't work for us.
customer_reviews.text: Costumer service is fantastic. The liners arrived as ordered and fit the diapers well. I was so excited to use them. Sadly my daughter has very reactive "delicate princess skin" and these caused her to rash out. Contacted the seller and was given a full refund!
customer_reviews.author: MetteK

customer_reviews.title: Great for catching poo, but....
customer_reviews.text: I liked these for a while, but when my son peed on them, they would stick to him and ended up giving him diaper rash! Had to stop using them. They were great for catching poo though, and my son doesn't eat solids yet.
customer_reviews.author: Standish Family

customer_reviews.title: Less poop to scrape
customer_reviews.text: I only scrape 10% of the poop compared to before using these. They wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: PT reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: They are useful although they not always contain the poo. You have to clean the excess anyway. But they work.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: These are just right for lining cloth diapers. Perhaps there are softer ones on the market, but my baby's skin has no complaints with these liners and they are a great bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany R. Mountz

customer_reviews.title: Makes clean up easy!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had these for my other two babies! Catches 90% of the poo! Makes washing a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Eh. These work but are rougher than other diaper ...
customer_reviews.text: Eh. These work but are rougher than other diaper liners we've used. I prefer the Lilbit liners though they come from China and need a lead time on ordering.
customer_reviews.author: L S

customer_reviews.title: Best Liners!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best liners I have tried yet. They are so much softer than other liners and the stick to my BumGenuis diapers a bit so they stay in play extremely well!!
customer_reviews.author: Kate L

customer_reviews.title: Good for poop, bad for pee
customer_reviews.text: These are great for keeping solids off of the diapers, however, they also seem to make it hard for pee to be absorbed by the diaper itself. Luckily, my little one is kinda on a schedule pooping wise, so I only use these while he would normally poop.
customer_reviews.author: Mama6

customer_reviews.title: Must have for cloth diapering!
customer_reviews.text: Great value, great product. I so wish I knew about these months ago! Makes cloth diapering SO much easier!
customer_reviews.author: eder

customer_reviews.title: Works for us all around
customer_reviews.text: I like these and have no complaints. As long as you position them in well they stay in place...no they don't make diapers leak. They are soft and the least expensive!
customer_reviews.author: johann cuellar

customer_reviews.title: I definitely won't be purchasing these again!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because the grovia liners that I usually use were out of stock. These do the job of catching poop and don't absorb and pee but they are made of the same material that lines the underside of couches and box springs.
customer_reviews.author: danielle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: For a new cloth diapering mommy this product made it so much easier to transition. I recommend it to all my cloth diapering mommy’s!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Gath

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: These caused my diapers to leak and the baby seemed very uncomfortable with them. He was fussy and moving his butt like they were hurting him. The texture is rough. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: life saver
customer_reviews.text: Never have to scrape poo when using these! Well...unless he has a major blowout! These are the only reason I was able to talk my husband into using cloth for our baby. So much easier, cheaper and a major time saver! Plus way less icky
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Makes cleaning poopy cloth diapers so much easier!
customer_reviews.text: Makes cleaning poopy cloth diapers so much easier! These are a lot softer than other brands that we have used.
customer_reviews.author: christen n. lewitzky

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We've been happy with the liners we had bought in the past, but these are so much better than even those good ones! They are so soft for baby. They are huge So you could cut them in half to have them last longer. They are thick enough to really get everything that it needs to.
customer_reviews.author: GarrettBritney

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Love these, good size, durable, easy tear. I would definitely Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Harkness

customer_reviews.title: Holds the poop pretty well, but I still have to rinse dippers
customer_reviews.text: Much softer then other brands I've tried. Holds the poop pretty well, but I still have to rinse dippers. Overall it does help make things a little less messy.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: and they don't stick to baby's bottom like some others I have tried (at least I haven't ...
customer_reviews.text: These work perfectly. They are soft and large enough to fully protect the diaper, and they don't stick to baby's bottom like some others I have tried (at least I haven't had a bad roll out of my first 3 or so). They come in huge rolls of 200 liners for around the same price as other rolls half the size, and they shipped fast! Super happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OMG, so soft!
customer_reviews.text: Oh so soft!!!! So happy that these are on the market. They are SUPER soft and still strong enough to hold my little man's poops. They are a great size too for wider diapers and can be easily folded for smaller babies. I'm in love!
customer_reviews.author: cristina rosemeyer

customer_reviews.title: Very soft!
customer_reviews.text: Works well for son's nasty toddler poops. Helps keep my diapers cleaner. We throw away, don't flush. Very soft!
customer_reviews.author: BeeSunshine

customer_reviews.title: Love these, gentle & natural fibers
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Super soft and gentle, pure bamboo with no added plastic fibers,so yes they tear easily but they hold poop well. Baby never had rash with these on his sensitive skin. Size is great, they offer good coverage on my alvas.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Great value and soft liners that don’t cause rashes
customer_reviews.text: These fit perfectly inside my BumGenius and Mama Kola diapers! Great value and soft liners that don’t cause rashes!
customer_reviews.author: kara

customer_reviews.title: great to help keep them clean as well as
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely necessary for cloth diapers, great to help keep them clean as well as baby
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: Great liners!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in hopes that they would be as good as our other more expensive brand. These are excellent. Same feel and quality. They hold together well and tear away from the roll easily. Will be our go to liners in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne Quartey

customer_reviews.title: Crap-catcher!!
customer_reviews.text: Lifesaverrrrrr! I LOVE these things. God I hate scraping/spraying/soaking clumps of crap out of cloth diapers. Do yourself a huge favor and buy these. They make cleanup sooooooo much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Keri Athanas

product_meta.title: Dandelion Diapers Biodegradable and Flushable Natural Diaper Liners, 100% Viscose Made From Bamboo, 200 Sheets
product_meta.description: Size:200 Sheet Roll| Color:ViscoseAt last, the company you have trusted for years for all of your cloth diapering needs now offers diaper liners. Dandelion Diaper Liner is made of viscose made from bamboo. Biodegradable, compostable, and flushable, they make an excellent natural solution. Simply place the liner between the baby's skin and the diaper. Fluids pass through liner while solids remain on top. When the liner is soiled simply flush solids in the toilet. Flush, compost, or toss soiled liners in the garbage.
feature_bullets: Makes diaper changes easy, Extends the life of your cloth diapers
Place the liner between baby's skin & diaper. Fluids pass through liner while solids remain on top. Flush, compost, or toss away. Biodegradable and Flushable
Free of harsh synthetic chemicals, dyes, fragrance, and preservatives.
